briefdescription.para: A single track is played once; there is no next track.
A single track is played repeatedly; the next track is the current track.
The tracks within a group are played once in track order.
The tracks within a group are played in track order repeatedly.
The tracks within a group are played once only from the oldest first.
The tracks within a group are played from the oldest first repeatedly.
The tracks within a group are played once only from the newest first.
The tracks within a group are played from the newest first repeatedly.
The tracks within a group are played in random order once.
The tracks within a group are played in random order repeatedly.
Media Playing order (Media Control Service Section 3.15 Playing Order)
The current track is inactive.
The current track is playing.
The current track is paused.
The current track is fast forwarding or fast rewinding.
Media State (Media Control Service Section 3.17 Media State)
Invalid Operation ID.

Set the current track to the nth track in the current group playing order.
Set the current group to the previous group in the sequence of groups.

Set the current group to the last group in the sequence of groups.
Set the current group to the nth group in the sequence of groups.
Media Control Opcode (Media Control Service Section 3.18 Media Control Point)
Action requested by the opcode write was completed successfully.
An invalid opcode was used for the Media Control Point write.
The Media Player State characteristic value is Inactive.
The requested action of any Media Control Point write cannot be completed successfully due to a condition within the player.

briefdescription.para: Media Control Basic Opcodes supported mask.
Media Control Segment Opcodes supported mask.
Media Control Track Opcodes supported mask.
Media Control Group Opcodes supported mask.
MCS/GMCS exposes characteristics that describe a single media player.

detaileddescription.para: A media player in this context is a device, or part of a device, that allows another device to control the media that is played. For example, a media player could be a television, a set-top box, a radio, a phone running a radio or music application, a phone running a podcast application, or a similar type of device or application. MCS does not directly manage the audio transport GMCS provides status and control of media playback for the device as a single unit.
